content: Hello @WG-async-foundations! It's time for our weekly triage meeting
Go ahead and react with a wave to show you're here

Here's our agenda for this week:

  • Announcements and introductions
  • New issue triage
  • Discussion on progress/blockers around sprint bugs
Not sure if folks saw, but I'll repeat it again here: I published part 3 of my futures concurrency series last week: https://blog.yoshuawuyts.com/futures-concurrency-3/
I've got that on my reading list!
I don't have any additional announcements. I don't know if there's anything else?
This covers the select! macro, the modes of concurrency it exposes, and alternatives to it. There's a Zulip thread on this stream about it in case you have thoughts or questions!
After last week, we decided to use this time to also let newcomers introduce themselves.
It doesn't look like we have anyone new so far this week, but if I've missed someone, feel free to say hi!
But if there are no more announcements and introductions, we can go ahead and move on to triage.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
For triage, we have no new issues!
(There was one, but we talked about it last week and I forgot to mark it as triaged)
So we can move on :)
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
So for whatever time we have left (which is a lot, we're speed running again today!), we can talk about progress on sprint issues, etc.
I'm thinking I should pick up an issue
I was going to work on intersection regions etc, but I've been talking to you about picking that up @eholk
so I guess I need something else :)
(though if you think you won't be able to do it, I might keep working on it)
Do you want to try and pair program it, @nikomatsakis?
That could work
Probably a good idea
Especially since I'm not really sure the full repercussions yet
I think I should be able to work on it, but I keep letting other things jump in front of the queue.
OK, let's coordinate separately on timing
Sounds good!
Yeah, I think I'll learn a lot more a lot faster if we at least start off with some pair programming time.
I made some progress last week on breaking up #93180 into separate fixes
(That's related to drop tracking ICEs, I realized a number's not super helpful)
The fix for one of the issues @tm found was merged with #93751
And drop tracking is behind a compiler flag now
Oh! One thing I should have mentioned in announcements but I'll mention now: this week on Thursday is the sprint planning meeting.
So some point before then it would be good to review https://hackmd.io/gPgXC4fsTZOgOnd-Bwhoag?both#2022-02-03
Thanks, I should get into the habit of mentioning that :)
oh gosh, already? That came around quickly
Anyway, I think that's all I have for this meeting.
Does anyone else have anything to discuss?
If not, we can go ahead and wrap up early.
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks everyone! As usual, the zulip stream is open for continued discussions. It has been fun seeing a lot more talk going on lately!
@tmandry @nikomatsakis have you started implementation on async fn in traits? Is that blocked on some impl Trait work or just waiting for someone to do it?
@Nick Cameron, @Santiago Pastorino has been working on impl Trait refactoring which would enable async fn in traits (and make the implementation a simple desugaring)
Neat!

tmandry said:

Nick Cameron, Santiago Pastorino has been working on impl Trait refactoring which would enable async fn in traits (and make the implementation a simple desugaring)

Nice! Out of curiosity, do we have a rough idea of how long this is going to take? Rough ballpark is fine, like "within the next month or two" or "6+ months from now."
my plan is to get back to this work next week
gonna keep posting about progress, unsure how long is going to take
we got blocked by some changes on hir that had some perf regressions and are needed
